fact_text: By Saturday evening, 90,000 people were put on immediate evacuation orders. For those unfamiliar with wildfires, parts of northern California are experiencing Hurricane force winds that are driving the fire quickly. The current wildfire, dubbed the Kincade Fire, began Wednesday night and is only 10% contained, the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection said Sunday. Now, some 180,000 people are being asked to leave their homes in Northern California due to the fire. As of Sunday, approximately 180,000 people were under evacuation warnings from the Kincade Fire, according to the Sonoma County Sheriff. The fire has burned more than 30,000 acres and over 180,000 have evacuated the area.
